title: This is really lame
body: Seriously, how does a game where its average rank is mid-gold and I WIN, (going 17/7/12) still end up as Bronze 1 placed.

replies.body: Keep in mind that the rank shown after your first ranked game is only a "minimum", and not a placement. You'll still have to complete all 10 provisional matches to get your placement, but you can be assured that you wont be placed below your assigned minimum.

Fresh accounts are usually going to place lower, even with a good win ratio just incase they fluked their way through 10 games (it does happen). Your LP gains are likely going to be significant, and you will climb incredibly quickly.
You say this but I got 70LP from the first, 60 from the second win and 54 from the third win.

I only won 3 of my promos I think and I got silver 4. I have no idea how the ranking system works coming out of promos but I do know in standard ranked games you will eventually reach the rank you deserve if you play enough games.
I won 9 of my promos and got placed Bronze I, fun fun
to make you spend more time playing LoL.

Because riot still decides your rank based on stupid indicators other then your MMR, so rank means nothing, and even the ranks that people have this season mean even less because Riot decided to move the goal posts so that Old Gold V is now Plat IV.
